Excited to hear more next week at re:Invent. These predictions are essential reading before Las Vegas.

author.headline: CEO at Amazon Web Services (AWS)

posted_at.relative: 7 hours ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

reshared_post.text:
Throughout history, the pattern repeats: new tools emerge and human capability gets amplified. We're entering a new era where interdisciplinary collaboration drives discovery at a rapid pace—an era where AI is in the human loop, not the other way around. 

This is creating massive opportunities to solve problems that truly matter. And in the coming year, I see this shift impacting everything. From how we combat loneliness and administer care to those that need it most, to how developers design and build systems, and most importantly, how we educate ourselves in a time of rapid change. 

Read my full tech predictions for 2026 and beyond https://lnkd.in/eHjPnxYB

matching_elements.text:
🚀 AWS Cost Monitoring, and specifically AWS Cost Anomaly Detection, had not just one, but TWO(!) launches for pre-re:Invent. On Friday we continued our investment in the underlying AI/ML models powering Cost 
Anomaly Detection, improving precision, recall, and latency with each iteration.

📋 What We Launched
■ Enhanced ML detection algorithm using rolling 24-hour windows 
■ Improved accuracy by accounting for workloads with different morning and evening usage patterns

💡 Key Benefits:
■ Faster anomaly identification: Rolling windows eliminate delays from waiting for actual cost to accumulate during incomplete calendar days
■ More accurate detection: Compares costs against similar times of day for better pattern recognition

🔗 Read the What's New post: https://lnkd.in/euwkzrXZ

Huge thanks to the incredible team behind this launch! To name a few..

Junrong Yan Jonathan Cen Divya Arora Keaton Mueller Claudio Georgete Neto Debojyoti Ghosh Lu Zhang Zixiao Wang   Sergio Daniel Moreno Puentes  Shubir Kapoor Dela Kobe A. Durga Pawani Reddy Basireddy  Edward Dinki  Eliza Knight Emily Yi Jacob Vacheresse Jennifer Huang  Leo Razoumov Noel Vazquez Tina Yun Bowen Wang  Som Chatterjee Jijo Philip  

Two launches in one week - and we're just getting started. Looking forward to seeing how these improvements help customers stay ahead of unexpected costs with even greater speed and accuracy.

#AWS #CostAnomalyDetection #MachineLearning #FinOps #CloudFinancialManagement #CloudCostOptimization #AWSLaunch #CustomerObsession #AIMLProductManagement

I’m excited to share that I’ll be on the ground in Las Vegas for #AWSreinvent 2025, and this year is a big one for Temporal Technologies.

If you’re interested in the intersection of GenAI, durable execution, and resilience, come find us. We're running a packed lineup of sessions all week, including:

🔹 Better Together: Building Resilient Agents at Scale with AgentCore + Temporal
Tue, Dec 2 | 1:00–2:30 PM PT | HaSalon, Palazzo 

🔹 Building Reliable Systems with EKS, Grafana Labs, and Temporal
Thu, Dec 4 | 1:00–2:30 PM PT | HaSalon, Palazzo 

🔹 Deploying Enterprise Agents: Resilient and Built for the Real World
Tue, Dec 2 | 3:25–3:55 PM | Developer Pavilion, Expo Floor

🔹Building Reliable AI Systems: Temporal Workflows with Strands Agents on AWS
Wed, Dec 3 | 12:40–1:10 PM | Developer Pavilion, Expo Floor

🔹 Durable Execution w/ New Relic (New Relic Booth #247)
Wed, Dec 3 | 3:30–3:45 PM

Whether you’re building AI agents, re-architecting critical workflows, or scaling cloud-native systems, swing by Booth #1382 or the HaSalon to see how Temporal is becoming a force multiplier for AWS customers.

Sing up for a session or book a meeting with me or anyone at Temporal through our Platinum sponsorship at the AWS Open Source Hangout in the Hasalon. Link in the description.


#generativeAI #AWS #AgenticAI #opensource #AWSreinvent

posted_at.relative: 2 days ago • Edited • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
Today, I built a meta-agent that spawns specialized sub-agents.  Each agent is created with their own system prompts, context, tools, and model. This is a powerful way to have an agent offload tasks to save on context while staying focused on a defined goal or series of tasks.

In this example I asked an agent to "get the latest news from last Friday": 

1. First, the agent got the current date and time to understand when "last Friday" was
2. Then it fetched the latest AWS news
3. From there it filtered for news relevant to Strands, AgentCore, MCP, and Agents
4. After that the agent used the use_agent tool to have sub-agents review the content
5. It also had the agents extract links to code samples and documentation
6. Finally the agent provided a structured response

I'll be demoing this live before re:Invent. More details coming soon.

#AIAgents #StrandsAgents #AWS

author.headline: Agentic AI @ AWS | Building Production Multi-Agent Workflows | International Speaker

matching_elements.text:
It’s not every day you’re invited to join an AWS VP on stage for an Innovation Talk - huge thanks to Deepak Singh for having me part of his session alongside Brittany Doncaster from Delta Air Lines. Truly an honor!

Innovation Talks are where AWS VPs share the "why" behind the technology we’re all building with. Deepak leads the team at AWS building developer experiences powered by generative AI including Kiro, and in this talk, we’ll explore how AI agents are transforming the entire development lifecycle, from prototype to production.

I’ll be sharing some hands-on coding demos with to show what this future looks like in practice. Brittany will bring her perspective as Chief Architect at Delta, and Deepak will walk us through how AWS is designing accessible, secure AI tools that keep developers in control, and his future visions for this space.

It’s not often you get to demo for a room full of builders while standing next to the VP who’s shaping the future of developer tools at AWS. Grateful for the trust, the team, and the chance to make complex ideas feel tangible!

Catch it on Thursday December 4th, 11:00 AM PST in Palazzo Ballroom B.  
RSVP 🔗 https://bit.ly/inv205

👩🏻‍💻 Follow me (Brooke Jamieson) to stay in the loop with the latest AWS + AI updates for developers

📍 save + share!

🏷️ Amazon Web Services (AWS)
#AWS #reInvent2025 #AIAgents #Kiro #DeveloperExperience #DevTools

matching_elements.text:
Join Amazon Web Services (AWS) Heroes Brian Tarbox and Brian H. Hough  for their session ‘Red Team vs Blue Team: Securing AI Agents’ at AWS re:Invent! 🚀 

AI agents are the next evolution of APIs, but they also bring new security challenges and attack vectors. In their session, the two Heroes will dive into:
➡️ Real-world threats like prompt injection, tool abuse, and agent-to-agent escalation
➡️ Defensive strategies with rate limiting, encrypted endpoints, and Amazon Bedrock Guardrails
➡️ How to build secure-by-default agents using Infrastructure as Code and Zero Trust principles

Register for AWS re:Invent here 👉 https://hubs.li/Q03RTgY40

matching_elements.text:
🚀 #CUDOS v5.7 is here – the #reInvent edition!

This release brings important edge security insights and waste reduction capabilities that every #FinOps team needs. Because in today's cloud-first world, eliminating waste isn't just about optimization – it's about operational excellence.

Here's what's new:
🛡️ 𝐍𝐞𝐰 𝐀𝐖𝐒 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐞𝐥𝐝 & 𝐖𝐀𝐅 𝐒𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
Complete visibility into your security spend with actionable waste reduction insights:
• Idle AWS WAF Web ACLs Detection – Identify Web ACLs with zero requests that are costing you money
• Shield Advanced Subscription Consolidation – Get recommendations to optimize Shield subscriptions across payer accounts
• Comprehensive spend breakdowns by service, usage type group, account, region, up to resource level details

📈 𝐄𝐧𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐝 𝐓𝐫𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐬 𝐀𝐧𝐚𝐥𝐲𝐬𝐢𝐬
Track monthly and weekly trends across any organizational taxonomy dimension – Business Unit, Environment, Cost Center, or any custom taxonomy you've defined. 

💸 𝐔𝐧𝐮𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐑𝐈/𝐒𝐏 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐢𝐭𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐈𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐬
New section on RI/SP Summary tab to track and eliminate unused commitment waste with detailed ARN-level visibility.

🔍 𝐂𝐥𝐨𝐮𝐝𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐃𝐮𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐃𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
New visuals to identify duplicate management event trails across accounts and regions – another hidden source of waste that adds up quickly.

📊 𝐀𝐦𝐚𝐳𝐨𝐧 𝐐𝐮𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐒𝐮𝐢𝐭𝐞 𝐄𝐧𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
Enhanced Analytics tab with Reader Pro and Author Pro user insights, plus Q Questions usage tracking.

🎯 𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 #FinOps:
Waste reduction is the fastest path to cost optimization. These new insights help you identify and eliminate hidden costs in security services – often overlooked but significant contributors to cloud spend. Every idle Web ACL and redundant Shield subscription directly impacts your bottom line.

📚 Full changelog - https://lnkd.in/emwXMZMH
📊 Explore demo dashboard - https://lnkd.in/eF2QWNYn
🛠️ Update CUDOS - https://lnkd.in/eDmYJpey
✨ Add your organizational taxonomy to CUDOS - https://lnkd.in/e7MYMGwz

🤝 This release is a result of fantastic collaboration with Brenno Passanha. Also many thanks to folks who provided valuable feedback Chris Pates, William Fairbrother, Andrew C. Christopher Jen Brian McEntire, AWS  Mylen Rath Anand Gaurav Loïc Fournier Iakov Gan  and many many others

#FinOps never ends! 🔄

👋 See you at #reInvent

💸 𝐔𝐧𝐮𝐬𝐞𝐝 𝐑𝐈/𝐒𝐏 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐢𝐭𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐈𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐬
new section on ri/sp summary tab to track and eliminate unused commitment waste with detailed arn-level visibility.

🔍 𝐂𝐥𝐨𝐮𝐝𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐃𝐮𝐩𝐥𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐃𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
new visuals to identify duplicate management event trails across accounts and regions – another hidden source of waste that adds up quickly.

📊 𝐀𝐦𝐚𝐳𝐨𝐧 𝐐𝐮𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐒𝐮𝐢𝐭𝐞 𝐄𝐧𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬
enhanced analytics tab with reader pro and author pro user insights, plus q questions usage tracking.

🎯 𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐟𝐨𝐫 #finops:
waste reduction is the fastest path to cost optimization. these new insights help you identify and eliminate hidden costs in security services – often overlooked but significant contributors to cloud spend. every idle web acl and redundant shield subscription directly impacts your bottom line.

📚 full changelog - https://lnkd.in/emwxmzmh
📊 explore demo dashboard - https://lnkd.in/ef2qwnyn
🛠️ update cudos - https://lnkd.in/edmyjpey
✨ add your organizational taxonomy to cudos - https://lnkd.in/e7mymgwz

🤝 this release is a result of fantastic collaboration with brenno passanha. also many thanks to folks who provided valuable feedback chris pates, william fairbrother, andrew c. christopher jen brian mcentire, aws  mylen rath anand gaurav loïc fournier iakov gan  and many many others

#finops never ends! 🔄

👋 see you at #reinvent

posted_at.relative: 6 days ago • Edited • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
I have built a number of features and services in Amazon over the many years. Some of the most impactful ones make it easy to do something but every now and then we launch something that is totally a game changer that makes a previously "almost" impossible thing easy. I am specially proud of the team for Tenant Isolation in Lambda. Now you can build a SaaS and have secure environments for each of your customers as needed. Great for agents or  sensitive workloads where you don't want to share memory/CPU between your customers. Previously, you had to create isolated compute environments to achieve this which makes building this isolation exorbitantly expensive to run and maintain. Now you write a Lambda function and invoke it with a "tenant id" to get an isolated compute for that tenant. Easy as Lambda :). Read about it below and since we're already in re:Invent launch season, sign up for the Serverless events if you can - we are launching some other big things in a couple of weeks that you wouldn't want to miss!

https://lnkd.in/gYHCbnht

author.headline: Director and General Manager at Amazon Web Services (AWS) - AWS Serverless (Lambda, EventBridge, Step Functions)

article.title: Streamlined multi-tenant application development with tenant isolation mode in AWS Lambda | Amazon Web Services
article.subtitle: aws.amazon.com

posted_at.relative: 5 days ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
This is the biggest pre:Invent announcement so far. Multi-attribute GSI for DynamoDB is a huge win! No more building your own composite keys for GSIs and having to backfill every time you need a new composite key.

Now you just include the separate attributes in the key schema and add them to your queries, and voila!

I'm still looking for the gotchas, but so far it looks good. If you spot anything that worries you about this, please share in the comments.

Announcement: https://lnkd.in/evy5bRUf

Developer guide: https://lnkd.in/exwy8fti

author.headline: I teach AWS and serverless | AWS Serverless Hero | Consultant

posted_at.relative: 5 days ago • Edited • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
This has flown under the radar and not got the attention it deserves.

With IPv6 support Lambda no longer needs NAT gateway for internet connectivity from a private subnet.

This should simplify many architectures and remove the cost associated with NAT Gateways. This is arguably the best pre:Invent announcement so far.

https://lnkd.in/ejXA8z2C

matching_elements.text:
Heading to AWS re:Invent 2025? Join us for an engaging Lightning Talk CMP352) where we'll showcase how organizations can unlock up to 40% better price performance on AWS Graviton using the Graviton Savings Dashboard.

In this dynamic 20-minute session, we'll demonstrate:
• Advanced analytics for workload modernization
• Data-driven migration strategies
• Real-time cost optimization techniques
• Actionable migration planning

📅 December 4th, 2025
⏰ 1:30 PM PST
📍 Mandalay Bay
🚶‍♂️ Walk-in session - no registration required! 
🔗 Session details: https://lnkd.in/efSuxF3G

💡 Can't make the session? Visit us at the AWS Village Compute Booth (M29/M30)! Meet the team - Rosa Corley, Rajani Guptan, and Bhavik Gandhi - for an interactive live demo. Get hands-on experience with the latest features, ask questions, and discover how to apply these insights to your workloads.

Don't miss this opportunity to transform cost insights into business results. Experience the enhanced AWS Graviton Savings Dashboard and accelerate your modernization journey.

#AWSreinvent #Graviton #CostOptimization #EC2 #AWSCompute

matching_elements.text:
Over the past year, I’ve had hundreds of conversations with customers about agentic AI. What stands out is the shift from exploring the technology to using it to solve real business problems.

We’re still early, but the momentum is unmistakable. I’ve shared a few reflections on what we’re seeing today and what’s ahead as we prepare for re:Invent 2025. Excited for what we’ll build together.

author.headline: VP, AWS Agentic AI

posted_at.relative: 3 weeks ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
You can tell I didn't use AI to write this article title because it breaks every rule there is! 
Here's the thing: re:Invent is chaos! There's so many places to be and people to see, so it's really hard to find time to click between social media, launch blogs, product pages, what's new posts, and docs pages to figure out what a launched service/feature means for your project or codebase. 

Instead, this year I am using the AWS Documentation MCP with Kiro to get up-to-date official docs right in my IDE, and then asking Kiro specific questions using the context from my repo to get pinpointed answers. 

In this blog, I show you a real S3 Tables migration example and how to set this up before re:Invent so you can focus on the fun stuff! 
 
Click to read the blog here 🔗 https://lnkd.in/eiy2Zaqd

What launch are you most excited for this year? 👇

👩🏻‍💻 Follow me (Brooke Jamieson) to stay in the loop with the latest AWS + AI updates for developers

📍 save + share!

🏷️ Amazon Web Services (AWS) · AWS Developers · AWS Events · Kiro

#KiroDotDev #reInvent #AWS #DevTools #MCP #KiroIDE

posted_at.relative: 0 months ago • Visible to anyone on or off LinkedIn

matching_elements.text:
💸 Have you ever built your perfect multi-account environment only to realize that you forgot about cost? 😅 This year at re:Invent Fredrik Tunvall and I will explore strategies and tools for cost governance that can scale with your business. Together with participants of our chalk talk, we'll discuss key governance mechanisms, budget controls and anomaly detection, while also addressing considerations for multi-account environments in AWS Organizations.

We'll run the session twice! So, if you're attending re:Invent and would like to join (or know someone who would benefit from this talk) - check out the catalog and reserve your seat: https://lnkd.in/eTyWbUST
Even if you don't get a chance to reserve the seat - there are usually plenty seats available on the day, so just mark the date, time, & location in your calendar - and join us then 🙂

I hope to see you there!
==================

#awscloud #awsreinvent #reinvent #cloudgovernance #cloudcosts #cloudfinancialmanagement #cloudcostgovernance #cloudfinops
